pr_title: Participant manager service - POST /sites/{siteId}/participants/import API endpoint implementation.

timeline.message: POST import participants API endpoint implementation.

timeline.author: saminguyen

timeline.bodyText: I do not think we should not be using Request objs as part of a different response object. Can you use ParticipantDetail here instead?
timeline.author: saminguyen

timeline.bodyText: you should probably have IMPORT_EMAIL_1 and IMPORT_EMAIL_2 being the two emails in Email_Import_Template.xlsx and have another one being INVALID_TEST_EMAIL = "mockito"
timeline.author: saminguyen
saminguyen
saminguyen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -157,4 +159,19 @@
     return ResponseEntity.status(inviteParticipantResponse.getHttpStatusCode())
         .body(inviteParticipantResponse);
   }
+
+  @PostMapping(
+      value = "/sites/{siteId}/participants/import",
+      produces = MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON_VALUE)
+  public ResponseEntity<ImportParticipantResponse> importParticipants(
+      @PathVariable String siteId,
+      @RequestHeader(name = USER_ID_HEADER) String userId,
+      @RequestParam MultipartFile file,
